commit_message:
Document experimental pipeline in Nova CI

Add a section in "core-review" to document how experimental pipeline would
be used by Nova developers in order to consume the resources at the
right time.

Change-Id: I5df377032c2fcec18cdf71af2568e028373bcced
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/38/381838/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: When do we run experimental CI jobs? ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Because we can't run all CI jobs in the check and gate pipelines, some jobs can be executed at demand, thanks to experimental pipeline. To run the experimental jobs, you need to comment your Gerrit review with "check experimental". The experimental jobs aim to test specific features, such as LXC containers or DVR with multiple nodes. Also, it might be useful to run them when we want to test backward compatibility will tools that deploy OpenStack outside Devstack (e.g. TripleO, etc). They can produce a non-voting feedback at how it works when we deprecate or remove some options or features in Nova.

commit_message:
Fix volume type 'is_public' flag update

Update 'is_public' flag only if flag is passed as an argument
while updating volume type. With this change If 'is_public' flag
is not passed by the user, its value will not be updated and
only arguments passed to the update api will be updated.

Added code to check if none of the argument is passed to update
volume-type then it raises the CommandError exception with
appropriate error message.

Change-Id: Ice52e204ebea5d35f04455e74e16745a8bcce3d4
Closes-Bug: #1548708
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-cinderclient refs/changes/82/286382/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: is_public = args.is_public if args.name is None and args.description is None and is_public is None: raise exceptions.CommandError('Specify volume type name, ' 'description, is_public or a combination thereof.') if is_public is not None: is_public = strutils.bool_from_string(is_public)

subject: Fix misleading error trace in trunk fullstack life cycle test
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-08 01:06:14.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/services/trunk/drivers/openvswitch/agent/exceptions.py', 'neutron/services/trunk/drivers/openvswitch/agent/ovsdb_handler.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/services/trunk/drivers/openvswitch/agent/test_ovsdb_handler.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/8d3d672176c3f1aa0002651eb7dcd049bfb1deea', 'message': 'Fix misleading error trace in trunk fullstack life cycle test

There is a race condition triggered by the test where a VM and subports
associated to trunk linked to the VM are deleted in fast sequence. What
happens is that subport removal can no longer store metadata associated
to the trunk as the trunk is being removed.

Even though the race does not lead to errors, the trace may mislead the
operator in thinking there is something worth investigating when in reality
everything is fine.

To solve this issue, we should avoid raising RuntimeError for when the
parent port is not found, because that prevents us from handling this
race correctly.

Related-blueprint: vlan-aware-vms

Change-Id: Ica757813fd0348235cc7b823eebf6d3588c79905
(cherry picked from commit 190ae4f645ce87bc572548545a92cb4b83f8ba0a)

commit_message:
Fix misleading error trace in trunk fullstack life cycle test

There is a race condition triggered by the test where a VM and subports
associated to trunk linked to the VM are deleted in fast sequence. What
happens is that subport removal can no longer store metadata associated
to the trunk as the trunk is being removed.

Even though the race does not lead to errors, the trace may mislead the
operator in thinking there is something worth investigating when in reality
everything is fine.

To solve this issue, we should avoid raising RuntimeError for when the
parent port is not found, because that prevents us from handling this
race correctly.

Related-blueprint: vlan-aware-vms

Change-Id: Ica757813fd0348235cc7b823eebf6d3588c79905
(cherry picked from commit 190ae4f645ce87bc572548545a92cb4b83f8ba0a)

commit_message:
Drop MANIFEST.in - it's not needed by pbr

Neutron already uses PBR:- setuptools.setup(
	setup_requires=['pbr>=1.8'],
	pbr=True)

This patch removes `MANIFEST.in` file as pbr generates a
sensible manifest from git files and some standard files
and it removes the need for an explicit `MANIFEST.in` file.

Change-Id: I902f29fedb4b756af978af52927bd32a51270dc8
Closes-Bug: #1608980

commit_message:
read kolla-build.conf by default

- This change makes kolla-build read is config file
  correctly by default.
- This change corrects the file name of the apt_sources_list
  and apt_preferences to include the distro.

trivial_fix

Change-Id: I4d8d677e878a90477e3517f779fe4afe3310df45

As keystoneclient and other services rely more on keystoneauth we should
assume that keystoneauth is our base auth library, not keystoneclient
and start to default to the objects provided from there. This will make
it easier to remove these objects when the time comes.

For the session independant parts of keystoneclient we should use the

commit_message:
Use exceptions from Keystoneauth

As keystoneclient and other services rely more on keystoneauth we should
assume that keystoneauth is our base auth library, not keystoneclient
and start to default to the objects provided from there. This will make
it easier to remove these objects when the time comes.

For the session independant parts of keystoneclient we should use the
exception names as provided by keystoneauth instead of the aliases in
keystoneclient.

Change-Id: Ic513046f8398a76c244e145d6cc3117cdf6bb4cd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-keystoneclient refs/changes/05/359705/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Zun container sandbox spec

Zun needs to manage containers as well as their associated IaaS
resources, such as IP addresses, security groups, ports, volumes,
etc.. To decouple the management of containers from their associated
resources, we proposed to introduce a new concept called ``sandbox``.

Partial-Implement: blueprint neutron-integration
Change-Id: Ibdf9e4842d81b5b88c73531b9031c692aa2e24e5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zun refs/changes/54/365754/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ==================== Container Networking ==================== Launchpad Blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/zun/+spec/neutron-integration Zun is a container management service for OpenStack. To achieve the mission, Zun must leverage Neutron for providing networking for Zun-provisioned containers. Problem description =================== Like Nova instances, Zun containers need networking for (i) external access to the internet and (ii) internal communications between containers across different hosts or between a container and another OpenStack resource (i.e. a Nova instance). Use cases --------- TBD Proposed change =============== 1. Introduce a new concept called ``sandbox``. Sandbox represents an isolated networking environment for one or multiple containers. For Linux container, an isolated networking environment can be implemented by using a dedicated network namespace. All containers within a sandbox will share a network namespace. In future, we could leverage sandbox to share other namespaces (i.e. IPC namespace). You could consider a sandbox with containers as a pod in Kubernetes. 2. For docker, implement sandbox by using a docker container. The sandbox container might be an empty container, but it will be attach to one or multiple Neutron ports for networking. A Zun container might attach to a sandbox container by using the option ``--net=container:<sandbox>``. After a Zun container attaches to a sandbox, it will have the same networking as the sandbox container. For example, it shares the private IP address, floating IP address, security groups, etc. 3. For docker, use nova-docker to provision a sandbox container. Nova has already implemented the logic for providing networking for a Nova instance. Leverage nova-docker will effectively reuse all the networking implementation from Nova. 4. Zun containers will be managed by Zun as before. After a sandbox is provisioned, Zun is responsible to connect a container to the sandbox. Design Principles ----------------- 1. Use Neutron for container networking. 2. Minimum duplication between Nova and Zun. If possibly, reuse everything that has been implemented in Nova. 3. Similar user experience between VMs and containers. In particular, the ways to configure networking of a container should be similar as the VM equivalent. Alternatives ------------ 1. Directly bind Neutron ports to containers. This will have a large amount of duplication between Nova and Zun. Basically, we need to copy all the networking related code from Nova to Zun, which is highly undesirable. 2. Use Kuryr. Kuryr is designed for users who use native tool (i.e. docker CLI) to manage containers. In particular, what Kuryr provided to translate API calls to docker to API calls to Neutron. Zun doesn't expose native APIs to end-users so Kuryr cannot address Zun's use cases. Data model impact ----------------- TBD REST API impact --------------- TBD Security impact --------------- TBD Notifications impact -------------------- TBD Other end user impact --------------------- TBD Performance Impact ------------------ TBD Other deployer impact --------------------- TBD Developer impact ---------------- TBD Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Hongbin Lu Other contributors: Work Items ---------- TBD Dependencies ============ TBD Testing ======= TBD Documentation Impact ==================== TBD References ==========

commit_message:
Fix tox_install.sh

Translation sync is broken with a recent change to tox_install.sh, see
http://logs.openstack.org/periodic/networking-ovn-propose-translation-update/7c27fe1/

Import changes for this file from neutron-vpnaas to allow to run
functional tests against neutron: We need to install the proper version
of neutron when testing neutron changes with functional tests from
this repo.
Otherwise those tests install neutron HEAD.

Use temporary directory for neutron install, add it to pep8 exclude list.

Conflicts:
	tools/tox_install.sh

Change-Id: Ia260ba0e9d8142f0eb63a0c85a273f80c118855b
(cherry picked from commit 07998fc4c7d0f89b00a045bae1379add39c4db3d)

commit_message:
pacemaker: increase timeouts for rabbitmq and redis

When we observe the 'stop timeout' values of pacemaker resources:
rabbitmq and redis, they are set to 90s. But for all other services, it
is set to 200s.
The overcloud deployment sometimes fails due to this with the error:
Error: Could not complete shutdown of rabbitmq-clone, 1 resources
remaining
Error performing operation: Timer expired

This patch updates the timeout for Redis and RabbitMQ to avoid this
error.

Change-Id: I8a3b3951a896ee3e8e5e09778e8ea4717e76a1b4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/55/385555/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix default Swift ring partition power

Looks like tripleo::ringbuilder::part_power is not used at all; actually
the partition power on the underclod is 18, which is the default in
puppet-swift if nothing else is defined.

Cherry-picked from commit d80a144b14ad5568a8820911a1e4349f23bc9fa9

Closes-Bug: 1631926
Change-Id: Ic32c44810aba3ccbb9429cf210f27843d8b6b2c4

commit_message:
Add retries to upstart/systemd reload

Sometimes the subsystem fails to restart due to what
looks like a race condition in the kernel scheduler.

This patch makes Ansible try a few more times before
failing.

Change-Id: Id6e51c52d2711c36c7b292dbae16654774c24540
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_cinder refs/changes/43/380543/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: register: reload_systemd until: reload_systemd | success retries: 5 delay: 2 register: reload_upstart until: reload_upstart | success retries: 5 delay: 2

commit_message:
Add workaround for functions in translation

Currently if translation data is function and translation path
runs over unresolved function's value (i.e. intermediate data is
function), translation works incorrectly and raises AttributeError.
This workaround makes translation skip rules, where translation values
contains inside functions.

NOTE: This patch is not solve issues, described by Zane Bitter in [1],
just add workaround for current mechanism. Also, it doesn't affect
destination values, just intermediate, which currently cannot be safely
resolved.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/heat/+bug/1620859

Change-Id: I5d7f8d3a615590325d38702b21f224ff3de33315
Closes-bug: #1630214
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/21/381921/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add usage example to documentation

This example is cobbled together from Keystone's use-case.

Change-Id: Ib0ab0926f2cc86e2b45dfccbf8f73c638ec90a6f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.cache refs/changes/12/357412/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: A simple example of oslo.cache in use:: from oslo_config import cfg from oslo_cache import core as cache CONF = cfg.CONF # Load config from file, either here or in an import cache.configure(CONF) example_cache_region = cache.create_region() cache.configure_cache_region(example_cache_region) MEMOIZE = cache.get_memoization_decorator(CONF, example_cache_region, "cache") @MEMOIZE def f(x): print x return x An example config file for this is:: [cache] enabled = true backend = dogpile.cache.memory In some cases, your project may want to have different caching parameters for different functions. To do this, create two different memoization decorators:: MEMOIZE1 = cache.get_memoization_decorator(CONF, example_cache_region, "cache-one") MEMOIZE2 = cache.get_memoization_decorator(CONF, example_cache_region, "cache-two") To configure these, make a section for each decorator:: [cache-one] enabled = true backend = dogpile.cache.memory [cache-two] enabled = false However, in order to read these sections, you must manually load them. (The function ``cache.configure`` only loads the section ``[cache]``.)
deleted_lines: To use oslo.cache in a project:: import oslo_cache

subject: Temporarily stop running tempest in default configs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-13 16:19:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/commit/246656b47718f04000f3e391ec43be41e98ac8fe', 'message': 'Temporarily stop running tempest in default configs

The main place we test tripleo-quickstart (ci.centos.org), struggles
to provide consistent results running tempest. The hardware there is
heterogenous, specifically three of the four chassis there have
slower CPU. When a job that runs tempest is scheduled to one of these
nodes, the deployed cloud can not handle the load and fails random
tests. This is problematic because it gives us a 75% false negative
rate for jobs that run tempest.

There is some new hardware being purchased for ci.centos.org that
will be put in a pool that can be specifically scheduled to. In the
worst case, we can re-enable tempest jobs at that time.

There is also some possibility of tuning the performance on the
underperforming CI nodes in order to drop the false negative rate.

Change-Id: I6302d20f869dfcf9517965468752d483c8acafbb
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-14 12:31:24.000000000', 'files': ['config/general_config/minimal.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/commit/23ff0166e5c65569506a2e1f3f43c104a6ab29b8', 'message': 'Temporarily stop running tempest in default configs

The main place we test tripleo-quickstart (ci.centos.org), struggles
to provide consistent results running tempest. The hardware there is
heterogeneous, specifically three of the four chassis there have
slower CPU. When a job that runs tempest is scheduled to one of these
nodes, the deployed cloud can not handle the load and fails random
tests. This is problematic because it gives us a 75% false negative
rate for jobs that run tempest.

There is some new hardware being purchased for ci.centos.org that
will be put in a pool that can be specifically scheduled to. In the
worst case, we can re-enable tempest jobs at that time.

There is also some possibility of tuning the performance on the
underperforming CI nodes in order to drop the false negative rate.

Change-Id: I6302d20f869dfcf9517965468752d483c8acafbb

commit_message:
Temporarily stop running tempest in default configs

The main place we test tripleo-quickstart (ci.centos.org), struggles
to provide consistent results running tempest. The hardware there is
heterogeneous, specifically three of the four chassis there have
slower CPU. When a job that runs tempest is scheduled to one of these
nodes, the deployed cloud can not handle the load and fails random
tests. This is problematic because it gives us a 75% false negative
rate for jobs that run tempest.

There is some new hardware being purchased for ci.centos.org that
will be put in a pool that can be specifically scheduled to. In the
worst case, we can re-enable tempest jobs at that time.

There is also some possibility of tuning the performance on the
underperforming CI nodes in order to drop the false negative rate.

Change-Id: I6302d20f869dfcf9517965468752d483c8acafbb

commit_message:
Add retries to db-sync

If db-sync fails, it will not be rerun until a configuration change or a
package update. This can lead to misconfigured databases, so we should
at least attempt to retry the sync process.

Change-Id: I04154381a307d60ce072806faea561f7ed1ee919
Related-Bug: #1628580

commit_message:
Fuel: release RC1 and create stable/newton branches

This is a request to release Fuel RC1 branched projects

Please branch stable/newton for these projects:
- openstack/fuel-agent
- openstack/fuel-astute
- openstack/fuel-library
- openstack/fuel-main
- openstack/fuel-menu
- openstack/fuel-nailgun-agent
- openstack/fuel-ostf
- openstack/fuel-qa
- openstack/fuel-ui
- openstack/fuel-virtualbox
- openstack/fuel-web

Change-Id: I9e636ff7c522d90002be44f891a5a91f4fec99bd

commit_message:
Fix tox_install.sh

Translation sync is broken with a recent change to tox_install.sh, see
http://logs.openstack.org/periodic/networking-ovn-propose-translation-update/7c27fe1/

Import changes for this file from neutron-vpnaas to allow to run
functional tests against neutron: We need to install the proper version
of neutron when testing neutron changes with functional tests from
this repo.
Otherwise those tests install neutron HEAD.

Use temporary directory for neutron install, add it to pep8 exclude list.

Change-Id: Ia260ba0e9d8142f0eb63a0c85a273f80c118855b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/83/386383/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: neutron_installed=$(echo "import neutron" | python 2>/dev/null ; echo $?) NEUTRON_DIR=$HOME/neutron set -e set -x install_cmd="pip install -c$1"# The devstack based functional tests have neutron checked out in # $NEUTRON_DIR on the test systems - with the change to test in it. # Use this directory if it exists, so that this script installs the # neutron version to test here. # Note that the functional tests use sudo to run tox and thus # variables used for zuul-cloner to check out the correct version are # lost. if [ -d "$NEUTRON_DIR" ]; then echo "FOUND Neutron code at $NEUTRON_DIR - using" $install_cmd -U -e $NEUTRON_DIR elif [ $neutron_installed -eq 0 ]; then location=$(python -c "import neutron; print(neutron.__file__)") echo "ALREADY INSTALLED at $location" # Make this relative to current working directory so that # git clean can remove it. We cannot remove the directory directly # since it is referenced after $install_cmd -e. mkdir -p .tmp NEUTRON_DIR=$(/bin/mktemp -d -p $(pwd)/.tmp) pushd $NEUTRON_DIR popd if [ -z "$NEUTRON_PIP_LOCATION" ]; then NEUTRON_PIP_LOCATION="git+https://git.openstack.org/openstack/neutron@$BRANCH_NAME#egg=neutron" fi $install_cmd -U -e ${NEUTRON_PIP_LOCATION}
deleted_lines: set -ex neutron_installed=$(echo "import neutron" | python 2>/dev/null ; echo $?) cwd=$PWD CONSTRAINTS_FILE=$1install_cmd="pip install" if [ $CONSTRAINTS_FILE != "unconstrained" ]; then install_cmd="$install_cmd -c$CONSTRAINTS_FILE" fi if [ $neutron_installed -eq 0 ]; then cd /tmp cd "$cwd" $install_cmd -U -egit+https://git.openstack.org/openstack/neutron@$BRANCH_NAME#egg=neutron

commit_message:
Hacking: Remove C305 contextlib.nested check

contextlib.nested no longer exists in Python 3,
so this check is not needed.  Any use of
contextlib.nested will fail py3 unit tests.

Change-Id: Ibc3bac5caa6e2ab76a4288150ae0f7a30bd1d37c

commit_message:
Change assertTrue(isinstance()) by optimal assert

Some of tests use different method of
assertTrue(isinstance(A, B)) or assertEqual(type(A), B).
The correct way is to use assertIsInstance(A, B) provided
by testtools

Change-Id: Ia5156aef65da766520485bbc9495b61918407f22

commit_message:
delete "--domain" option when create project or user with "openstack" command.

subcommand "project create" of openstack does no longer include a "--domain" option, more info:
    usage: openstack project create [-h] [-f {json,shell,table,value,yaml}]
                                [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>]
                                [--noindent] [--prefix PREFIX]
                                [--description <description>]
                                [--enable | --disable]
                                [--property <key=value>] [--or-show]
                                <project-name>

subcommand "user create" of openstack is similar to "project create".

Change-Id: I20532274078a6a6ef68b7759681577f24a5c8a8c
Closes-Bug: #1633366
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/61/386461/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $ openstack project create \ $ openstack project create \ $ openstack user create \
deleted_lines: $ openstack project create --domain default \ $ openstack project create --domain default \ $ openstack user create --domain default \

commit_message:
Make heat.conf setting optional for heat::keystone::domain

If you split keystone and heat onto different nodes, you will want
to run this domain configuration on the keystone node to create the
domain without leaving behind a not-required heat.conf.

Change-Id: I573dc60685c4a8f502ee44d6f2610aa4eb8dd6b4
Partial-Bug: #1631130

commit_message:
Stop passing root device hints via kernel cmdline

In order to support a more complex syntax for root device hints, such as
having operators, we should stop passing the hints via the kernel
command line. Currently, IPA >= 1.3.0 already supports getting the root
devices directly from the node object itself and do not rely on the
kernel command line anymore.

Partial-Bug: #1561137
Change-Id: I6c4f316d181c67e20860f67ced71f0f1f67b0e79
